data.text: @WandrMe Stop living in fear the data doesn’t support it.

@WandrMe Everybody is getting and spreading Omicron so the whole "unvaccinated are dangerous" stuff is old news.

Masks may or may not make some difference at a conference, but if that's going to make that kind of difference to you, maybe you should decline the invitation?

@WandrMe my wife is a school teacher, and here in Washington the masks are coming off. But, it is a local community.

the issue with a conference is the diversity of persons intermingled, coming from many communities, a much bigger footprint.

@Satcom_Guru @WandrMe If everybody was wearing “proper” masks it might help. But most including myself are walking around with the equivalent of a pair of pants on their face, which is utterly pointless.

@WandrMe i don’t want to get Covid.
i am vaccinated and double boosted
all i can do is wear a good mask and distance.
and hope others will to?

this is the new reality, i am just not really ready for it, 
we have to be brave?

i am convinced the unmask decisions are driven by popularity.
@WandrMe Little downside, little effect can still be better than big downside, medium effect.

@WandrMe Like.. wearing a mask for a while, then shedding it at collective lunch and dinner and after-dinner drinks?

Like allowing unvaccinated decide if they want to take the risks of attending for themselves?
@mtlmkr Doing something useless just because it is easy doesn't make it any more helpful in addressing the concern, though.
@WandrMe Also the easiest and least invasive measure.
